Manages an Escalation within Opsgenie.

## Example Usage

{{< chooser language "typescript,python,go,csharp" / >}}

{{% example csharp %}}
```csharp
using Pulumi;
using Opsgenie = Pulumi.Opsgenie;

class MyStack : Stack
{
    public MyStack()
    {
        var test = Output.Create(Opsgenie.GetEscalation.InvokeAsync(new Opsgenie.GetEscalationArgs
        {
            Name = "existing-escalation",
        }));
    }

}
```

{{% /example %}}

{{% example go %}}
```go
package main

import (
	"github.com/pulumi/pulumi-opsgenie/sdk/go/opsgenie"
	"github.com/pulumi/pulumi-opsgenie/sdk/go/opsgenie/"
	"github.com/pulumi/pulumi/sdk/v2/go/pulumi"
)

func main() {
	pulumi.Run(func(ctx *pulumi.Context) error {
		_, err := opsgenie.LookupEscalation(ctx, &opsgenie.LookupEscalationArgs{
			Name: "existing-escalation",
		}, nil)
		if err != nil {
			return err
		}
		return nil
	})
}
```

{{% /example %}}

```python

```

        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type"><a href="#getescalationrule">Sequence[Get<wbr>Escalation<wbr>Rule]</a></span>
    </dt>
    <dd>{{% md %}}Escalation rules
{{% /md %}}</dd>
</dl>

<dl class="package-details">
	<dt>Repository</dt>
	<dd><a href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-opsgenie">https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-opsgenie</a></dd>

	<dt>Notes</dt>
	<dd>This Pulumi package is based on the [`opsgenie` Terraform Provider](https://github.com/opsgenie/terraform-provider-opsgenie).</dd>
</dl>
